storyTitle: As Insurance Agent, I want to enter applicant personal details to achieve accurate identification of the applicant

testCases.title: Validate successful applicant data entry with valid inputs
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized insurance agent
User has active internet connection
Applicant data entry page is accessible
Database is available and responsive

steps.action: Navigate to applicant data entry page
steps.expectedResult: Applicant form is displayed with all mandatory fields including name, date of birth, gender, and contact details. Form loads within 2 seconds

steps.action: Enter valid first name (e.g., 'John') in the First Name field
steps.expectedResult: First name is accepted without validation errors. Field displays entered text

steps.action: Enter valid last name (e.g., 'Smith') in the Last Name field
steps.expectedResult: Last name is accepted without validation errors. Field displays entered text

steps.action: Enter valid date of birth (e.g., '01/15/1985') in the Date of Birth field
steps.expectedResult: Date is auto-formatted correctly. No validation errors are shown. Age is calculated automatically if applicable

steps.action: Select gender from the dropdown (e.g., 'Male')
steps.expectedResult: Gender is selected and displayed in the field. No validation errors are shown

steps.action: Enter valid phone number (e.g., '5551234567') in the Phone Number field
steps.expectedResult: Phone number is auto-formatted to standard format (e.g., '(555) 123-4567'). No validation errors are shown

steps.action: Verify all mandatory fields are completed and no validation errors are present
steps.expectedResult: All fields show valid data. No error messages are displayed. Submit button is enabled

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Form is submitted successfully. Applicant data is saved to the database. Confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Applicant data saved successfully'). Unique applicant ID is generated and displayed

postconditions: Applicant record is created in the database with unique ID
All entered data is persisted and retrievable
Agent can proceed to next step in the workflow
Audit log entry is created for the data entry action

testCases.title: Verify rejection of form submission with missing mandatory fields
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized insurance agent
User has active internet connection
Applicant data entry page is accessible
Real-time validation is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to applicant data entry page
steps.expectedResult: Applicant form is displayed with all mandatory fields clearly marked (e.g., with asterisk or 'Required' label)

steps.action: Enter valid first name (e.g., 'Jane') in the First Name field
steps.expectedResult: First name is accepted. Field shows valid state

steps.action: Leave the Last Name field empty and move focus to the next field
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation triggers. Inline error message is displayed below or next to the Last Name field (e.g., 'Last Name is required'). Field is highlighted in red or error color

steps.action: Enter valid date of birth (e.g., '03/20/1990') in the Date of Birth field
steps.expectedResult: Date is accepted and auto-formatted. No validation errors for this field

steps.action: Leave the Gender field unselected
steps.expectedResult: Gender field remains empty. Error state may be indicated

steps.action: Enter valid phone number (e.g., '5559876543') in the Phone Number field
steps.expectedResult: Phone number is accepted and auto-formatted. No validation errors for this field

steps.action: Attempt to click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is blocked. Submit button may be disabled or clicking it triggers validation. Error summary message is displayed at the top of the form (e.g., 'Please correct the errors below before submitting')

steps.action: Verify all missing mandatory fields are highlighted with error messages
steps.expectedResult: Last Name field shows error message 'Last Name is required'. Gender field shows error message 'Gender is required'. All error fields are highlighted. Form focus moves to the first error field

steps.action: Verify that no data is submitted to the database
steps.expectedResult: No applicant record is created. No API call to POST /api/applicants is made or it returns validation error response

postconditions: No applicant record is created in the database
Form remains on the same page with entered data preserved
Error messages are clearly visible to the agent
Agent can correct errors and resubmit

testCases.title: Ensure draft save and resume functionality works correctly
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized insurance agent
User has active internet connection
Applicant data entry page is accessible
Draft save functionality is enabled
Session management is configured correctly

steps.action: Navigate to applicant data entry page
steps.expectedResult: Applicant form is displayed with all fields empty. 'Save as Draft' button is visible and enabled

steps.action: Enter partial applicant data: First Name 'Robert', Last Name 'Johnson', Date of Birth '05/10/1988'
steps.expectedResult: All entered fields accept the data without errors. Fields display the entered information

steps.action: Leave Gender and Phone Number fields empty
steps.expectedResult: Fields remain empty. No validation errors are shown for draft save

steps.action: Click the 'Save as Draft' button
steps.expectedResult: Draft is saved successfully. Confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Draft saved successfully'). Draft ID is generated and displayed or stored in session. No mandatory field validation is enforced for draft save

steps.action: Note the draft ID or confirmation details, then close the browser or navigate away from the page
steps.expectedResult: Page closes or navigates away. Draft data is persisted in the database or session storage

steps.action: Reopen the browser and log in again as the same insurance agent
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged in and authenticated

steps.action: Navigate back to the applicant data entry page or access the saved draft from drafts list
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with previously saved draft data loaded. First Name shows 'Robert', Last Name shows 'Johnson', Date of Birth shows '05/10/1988'. Gender and Phone Number fields remain empty as they were not filled

steps.action: Complete the remaining mandatory fields: Select Gender as 'Male' and enter Phone Number '5551112222'
steps.expectedResult: Gender is selected successfully. Phone number is entered and auto-formatted to '(555) 111-2222'. All mandatory fields are now complete. No validation errors are shown

steps.action: Click the Submit button to finalize the applicant data
steps.expectedResult: Form is submitted successfully. Draft status is changed to completed. Applicant data is saved permanently to the database. Confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Applicant data saved successfully'). Unique applicant ID is generated

steps.action: Verify the applicant record is retrievable and complete
steps.expectedResult: Applicant record can be retrieved using GET /api/applicants/{id}. All data fields are correctly saved and match the entered information

postconditions: Draft is converted to a completed applicant record
All applicant data is persisted in the database
Draft entry is removed from drafts list or marked as completed
Agent can proceed with the insurance quote process
Audit trail shows draft creation, save, and final submission

storyTitle: As Insurance Agent, I want to input applicant contact information to achieve reliable communication channels

testCases.title: Validate acceptance of correctly formatted contact information
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized insurance agent
User has active internet connection
Contact information section is accessible
Applicant record exists or is being created
Database is available and responsive

steps.action: Navigate to contact information section of the applicant form
steps.expectedResult: Contact form is displayed with fields for phone number, email address, and mailing address. All fields are empty and ready for input. Validation response time is under 1 second

steps.action: Enter valid phone number '5551234567' in the Phone Number field
steps.expectedResult: Phone number is accepted and auto-formatted to standard format '(555) 123-4567'. No validation errors are shown. Field displays green checkmark or valid state indicator

steps.action: Enter valid email address 'john.smith@example.com' in the Email Address field
steps.expectedResult: Email address is accepted. Real-time validation confirms correct format. No validation errors are shown. Field displays valid state indicator

steps.action: Enter valid mailing address: Street '123 Main Street', City 'Springfield', State 'IL', ZIP '62701'
steps.expectedResult: All address fields accept the data. No validation errors are shown. ZIP code may be auto-formatted if applicable

steps.action: Verify all contact fields show valid data with no error messages
steps.expectedResult: All fields display entered data correctly. No error messages are present. Save button is enabled

steps.action: Click the Save button to save the contact information
steps.expectedResult: Contact information is saved successfully to the database via POST /api/applicants/contact. Confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Contact information saved successfully'). Data is persisted and linked to the applicant record

postconditions: Contact information is saved in the applicant contact info tables
Data is retrievable and correctly associated with the applicant
Agent can proceed to next section or submit the complete application
Audit log entry is created for the contact information save action

testCases.title: Verify rejection of invalid phone and email formats
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized insurance agent
User has active internet connection
Contact information section is accessible
Real-time validation with regex is enabled
Validation response time is under 1 second

steps.action: Navigate to contact information section of the applicant form
steps.expectedResult: Contact form is displayed with empty fields for phone number, email address, and mailing address

steps.action: Enter invalid phone number '123' in the Phone Number field and move focus to next field
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation triggers within 1 second. Inline validation error message is displayed (e.g., 'Please enter a valid 10-digit phone number'). Field is highlighted in red or error color. Error icon is displayed next to the field

steps.action: Enter invalid email address 'invalidemail@' in the Email Address field and move focus to next field
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation triggers within 1 second. Inline validation error message is displayed (e.g., 'Please enter a valid email address'). Field is highlighted in red or error color. Error icon is displayed next to the field

steps.action: Enter valid mailing address: Street '456 Oak Avenue', City 'Chicago', State 'IL', ZIP '60601'
steps.expectedResult: Address fields accept the data. No validation errors for address fields

steps.action: Attempt to click the Save button
steps.expectedResult: Save action is blocked. Button may be disabled or clicking triggers validation summary. Error summary message is displayed at the top (e.g., 'Please correct the errors below before saving'). Form does not submit

steps.action: Verify that both phone and email fields display error messages
steps.expectedResult: Phone Number field shows error: 'Please enter a valid 10-digit phone number'. Email Address field shows error: 'Please enter a valid email address'. Both fields remain highlighted in error state

steps.action: Correct the phone number to valid format '5559876543'
steps.expectedResult: Phone number is accepted and auto-formatted to '(555) 987-6543'. Error message for phone field disappears. Field changes to valid state with green indicator

steps.action: Correct the email address to valid format 'jane.doe@example.com'
steps.expectedResult: Email address is accepted. Error message for email field disappears. Field changes to valid state with green indicator

steps.action: Verify all validation errors are cleared and Save button is enabled
steps.expectedResult: No error messages are displayed. All fields show valid state. Save button is enabled and clickable

steps.action: Click the Save button
steps.expectedResult: Contact information is saved successfully. Confirmation message is displayed. Data is persisted to the database

postconditions: Contact information is saved only after all validation errors are corrected
Invalid data is not persisted to the database
Agent understands the correct format requirements
Form maintains data integrity with proper validation

testCases.title: Ensure contact information persistence after form reload
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized insurance agent
User has active internet connection
Contact information section is accessible
Applicant record exists in the database
Data persistence mechanism is functioning correctly

steps.action: Navigate to contact information section of the applicant form
steps.expectedResult: Contact form is displayed with empty fields ready for input

steps.action: Enter valid phone number '5552223333' in the Phone Number field
steps.expectedResult: Phone number is accepted and auto-formatted to '(555) 222-3333'. No validation errors

steps.action: Enter valid email address 'michael.brown@example.com' in the Email Address field
steps.expectedResult: Email address is accepted. Real-time validation confirms correct format. No validation errors

steps.action: Enter valid mailing address: Street '789 Elm Street', City 'Boston', State 'MA', ZIP '02101'
steps.expectedResult: All address fields accept the data. No validation errors

steps.action: Click the Save button to save the contact information
steps.expectedResult: Contact information is saved successfully. Confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Contact information saved successfully'). Data is persisted to the database via POST /api/applicants/contact

steps.action: Note the applicant ID or record identifier for reference
steps.expectedResult: Applicant ID is visible and noted for retrieval

steps.action: Refresh the browser page or navigate away and return to the contact information section
steps.expectedResult: Page reloads successfully. Contact information form is displayed again

steps.action: Verify that previously saved contact information is displayed in the form fields
steps.expectedResult: Phone Number field displays '(555) 222-3333'. Email Address field displays 'michael.brown@example.com'. Mailing address fields display: Street '789 Elm Street', City 'Boston', State 'MA', ZIP '02101'. All data matches what was previously saved

steps.action: Edit the phone number to '5554445555' and email to 'michael.brown.updated@example.com'
steps.expectedResult: Phone number is updated and auto-formatted to '(555) 444-5555'. Email address is updated and validated. No validation errors are shown

steps.action: Click the Save button to save the updated contact information
steps.expectedResult: Updated contact information is saved successfully. Confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Contact information updated successfully'). Changes are persisted to the database

steps.action: Reload the form page again to verify the updates persisted
steps.expectedResult: Page reloads. Contact information form displays the updated data: Phone Number '(555) 444-5555', Email 'michael.brown.updated@example.com', and unchanged address. All updates are correctly reflected

postconditions: Contact information is persistently stored in the database
Data retrieval works correctly across sessions
Updates to contact information are saved and reflected accurately
Data integrity is maintained through save and reload cycles
Audit trail shows initial save and subsequent update actions

storyTitle: As Insurance Agent, I want to enter applicant history details to achieve comprehensive risk profiling

testCases.title: Validate successful entry of multiple applicant history records
preconditions: User is logged in as an Insurance Agent with valid credentials
User has appropriate permissions to access applicant history section
Applicant profile exists in the system
Database connection is active and stable
Browser is compatible and up to date

steps.action: Navigate to the applicant history section from the main dashboard or applicant profile page
steps.expectedResult: History entry form is displayed with all required fields visible including previous claims, coverage periods, and insurers fields

steps.action: Enter first history record with valid data: Previous insurer name 'ABC Insurance', coverage period from '01/01/2020' to '12/31/2020', claim amount '$5,000', claim date '06/15/2020', and claim type 'Property Damage'
steps.expectedResult: First history record is accepted without validation errors, all fields display entered data correctly

steps.action: Click 'Add Another Record' button to add a second history entry
steps.expectedResult: A new blank history entry form appears below the first record

steps.action: Enter second history record with valid data: Previous insurer name 'XYZ Insurance', coverage period from '01/01/2021' to '12/31/2021', claim amount '$3,500', claim date '09/20/2021', and claim type 'Liability'
steps.expectedResult: Second history record is accepted without validation errors, no error messages are shown, both records are visible on the form

steps.action: Click 'Add Another Record' button to add a third history entry
steps.expectedResult: A third blank history entry form appears below the second record

steps.action: Enter third history record with valid data: Previous insurer name 'DEF Insurance', coverage period from '01/01/2022' to '12/31/2022', no claims filed
steps.expectedResult: Third history record is accepted, optional claim fields can be left blank without errors

steps.action: Review all three entered history records for accuracy and completeness
steps.expectedResult: All three records are displayed correctly with all entered information visible and properly formatted

steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to submit the history data
steps.expectedResult: System processes the save request, loading indicator appears briefly, success confirmation message is displayed stating 'Applicant history saved successfully', page response time is under 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the saved data by refreshing the page or navigating away and returning to the applicant history section
steps.expectedResult: All three history records are retrieved and displayed correctly with all previously entered data intact

postconditions: Three applicant history records are saved in the database
Data is associated with the correct applicant profile
Audit log records the data entry action with timestamp and user information
History data is available for risk profiling and quote generation
User remains on the applicant history page or is redirected to applicant summary

testCases.title: Verify rejection of incomplete or invalid history data
preconditions: User is logged in as an Insurance Agent with valid credentials
User has appropriate permissions to access applicant history section
Applicant profile exists in the system
Validation rules are configured correctly in the system
Browser JavaScript is enabled for client-side validation

steps.action: Navigate to the applicant history section from the main dashboard or applicant profile page
steps.expectedResult: History entry form is displayed with all required fields marked with asterisks or 'Required' labels

steps.action: Leave the mandatory 'Previous Insurer Name' field blank and enter valid data in other fields: coverage period from '01/01/2020' to '12/31/2020'
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error message appears near the 'Previous Insurer Name' field stating 'This field is required' or similar message

steps.action: Enter 'ABC Insurance' in the 'Previous Insurer Name' field, but leave the mandatory 'Coverage Start Date' field blank
steps.expectedResult: Previous error clears, new inline validation error appears near the 'Coverage Start Date' field stating 'Coverage start date is required'

steps.action: Enter an invalid date format '13/45/2020' in the 'Coverage Start Date' field
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error appears stating 'Invalid date format. Please use MM/DD/YYYY' or similar message

steps.action: Enter valid 'Coverage Start Date' as '01/01/2020' but enter 'Coverage End Date' as '12/31/2019' (end date before start date)
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error appears stating 'Coverage end date must be after start date' or similar message

steps.action: Correct the 'Coverage End Date' to '12/31/2020', then enter a 'Claim Date' as '06/15/2019' (outside coverage period)
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error appears stating 'Claim date must fall within the coverage period' or similar message

steps.action: Enter a negative value '-1000' in the 'Claim Amount' field
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error appears stating 'Claim amount must be a positive number' or similar message

steps.action: Enter non-numeric characters 'ABC' in the 'Claim Amount' field
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error appears stating 'Claim amount must be a valid number' or field prevents non-numeric input

steps.action: Attempt to click the 'Save' button while validation errors are still present on the form
steps.expectedResult: Save action is blocked, button may be disabled or clicking produces no action, error summary message appears at top of form stating 'Please correct the errors below before saving', form does not submit

steps.action: Correct all validation errors by entering valid data in all mandatory fields with proper formats and date ranges
steps.expectedResult: All validation error messages disappear, 'Save' button becomes enabled or clickable

steps.action: Click the 'Save' button after correcting all errors
steps.expectedResult: Form submits successfully, success confirmation message is displayed, data is saved to the database

postconditions: No invalid data is saved to the database
Form validation rules are enforced consistently
User is informed of all validation errors clearly
Only corrected valid data is persisted in the system
Data integrity is maintained in the applicant history tables

testCases.title: Ensure editing and deletion of history entries function correctly
preconditions: User is logged in as an Insurance Agent with valid credentials
User has appropriate permissions to edit and delete applicant history
Applicant profile exists in the system
At least one applicant history record already exists in the database
Database supports update and delete operations

steps.action: Navigate to the applicant history section and click 'Add New Record' button
steps.expectedResult: Blank history entry form is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Enter first history record with valid data: Previous insurer 'ABC Insurance', coverage period '01/01/2020' to '12/31/2020', claim amount '$5,000', claim date '06/15/2020'
steps.expectedResult: Data is entered without validation errors

steps.action: Click 'Add Another Record' and enter second history record: Previous insurer 'XYZ Insurance', coverage period '01/01/2021' to '12/31/2021', claim amount '$3,500', claim date '09/20/2021'
steps.expectedResult: Second record is added without validation errors

steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to save both history records
steps.expectedResult: Success message is displayed stating 'Records saved successfully', both records are persisted in the database and displayed in the history list

steps.action: Locate the first history record (ABC Insurance) in the saved records list and click the 'Edit' button or icon next to it
steps.expectedResult: The history record opens in edit mode with all fields populated with the existing data, fields are editable

steps.action: Modify the claim amount from '$5,000' to '$6,500' and change the claim date from '06/15/2020' to '07/20/2020'
steps.expectedResult: Changes are accepted in the form fields without validation errors, modified values are displayed correctly

steps.action: Click the 'Save Changes' or 'Update' button to save the edited record
steps.expectedResult: Success message is displayed stating 'Record updated successfully', form returns to view mode or list view

steps.action: Verify the edited record by viewing it in the history list or reopening it
steps.expectedResult: The first record now shows updated claim amount '$6,500' and claim date '07/20/2020', all other fields remain unchanged, changes are reflected correctly

steps.action: Refresh the page or navigate away and return to the applicant history section
steps.expectedResult: The edited data persists after page refresh, updated values are still displayed correctly

steps.action: Locate the second history record (XYZ Insurance) in the saved records list and click the 'Delete' button or icon next to it
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears asking 'Are you sure you want to delete this history record?' with 'Cancel' and 'Delete' options

steps.action: Click 'Cancel' in the confirmation dialog
steps.expectedResult: Dialog closes, record is not deleted, second record remains in the history list

steps.action: Click the 'Delete' button again for the second history record (XYZ Insurance)
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears again

steps.action: Click 'Delete' or 'Confirm' in the confirmation dialog
steps.expectedResult: Success message is displayed stating 'Record deleted successfully', the second record (XYZ Insurance) is removed from the history list immediately

steps.action: Verify that only the first record (ABC Insurance with updated data) remains in the history list
steps.expectedResult: Only one history record is displayed showing ABC Insurance with claim amount '$6,500' and claim date '07/20/2020'

steps.action: Refresh the page or navigate away and return to verify deletion persistence
steps.expectedResult: After page refresh, only the first record remains, the deleted record does not reappear, changes are persisted in the database

postconditions: Edited history record contains updated information in the database
Deleted history record is permanently removed from the database
Remaining history records are intact and unaffected
Audit log records both edit and delete actions with timestamps and user information
Data integrity is maintained after edit and delete operations
Only one history record (ABC Insurance with updated data) exists for the applicant
